intro: Tessmanniodoxa dianeura, commonly known as the Dianeura tessmannii, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae, which includes many ornamental and horticulturally important species. The plant is characterized by its striking, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. It typically grows as an epiphyte, clinging to tree trunks in humid, shaded environments. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and valuable species in botanical collections.
